Fields.DialogueText: Kumano, is this really the time?
*ALARM*
Oh, come on, just turn around for a second.

Fields.MenuText: Kumano, what are you doing!? This is a battle!
Kumano, put the pen down and let's fight!
Good idea, Kumano. We should strike from their flank.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, I know! Just give me a minute. This is important!
Grr. This is going to take all day at this rate.
Huh? Oh, yes, that's what I meant.
Let's go. What are you doing in that book that's so important, anyway?
None of your business.
Don't make me order you to show me.
I'm honestly tempted. I'm quite proud of my results thus far.
*BOOM*
Ugh, we don't have time for this. Just get your head in the game.
Always was.
@BATTLE
What business?
Business.
Rhetorical question.
Maybe if I shade this here... Yeah, I think I can do that.
What is she doing? She's had her head in that notebook of hers for a while now.

Fields.MenuText: I think she's drawing.
Does it matter? We're still beating the Morganas.
Why don't you ask her yourself?

Fields.DialogueText: Drawing what? She's supposed to help us fight Morganas, not make pretty pictures.
For now. It'll matter a lot more when we're dead because she was distracted.
No thanks. I've still got bruises from the last time we talked.
If you're too much of a coward to talk to her yourself, then you can't complain. She's a sailor like the rest of us.
A sailor that can throw a grown man clear across her deck without breaking a sweat.
Kanchou, I'm sensing some Morganas approaching from the west.
Thank you, Kumano. We'll sound the alarm.
I'll be here...getting ready and stuff.
Her idea of getting ready is doodling?
She sensed the Morganas, didn't she? Clearly she can multitask.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I was wondering if you could do me a favor.

Fields.MenuText: Depends on what that favor is.
Of course. What do you need?
Well, you're certainly right to it today. No, "How was your day, Captain?" or, "You're looking very dashing, Captain."

Fields.DialogueText: It's really small. You'll hardly even notice it.
Well, keep in mind you already agreed, so no takesy-backsies.
Fine. You look incredible today, Kanchou. You must've had one of the best days ever. Shall I go on?
Just get on with it. What do you want, Kumano?
I was hoping we might be able to...take our time the next time we encounter Morganas.
Take our time? Meaning...?
Just maybe not beat them as fast as we usually do.
Go easy on them?
No... just... maybe think of it like playing with our food.
*ALARM*
Speak of the devil.
Pretty please?
Not this time, but we'll discuss it, okay?
Thanks. That's all I ask.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, there are Morganas to our west.
All right, let's take care of them.
Can we...you know...?
... Okay, we'll take our time. Is that what you want to hear?
It's exactly what I want to hear. Thanks, Kanchou.
We'll shoot to cripple, but not kill. Initially.
Sorry, I'll try to be quick.

Fields.MenuText: Take your time, Kumano. We don't want to have to do this again.
Don't try. Be. We don't have all day.
And we'll try to be slow. Should even out.

Fields.DialogueText: You have a point. I'll be careful not to make any mistakes.
I'll be quick.
Sounds good. Let's just make sure the battle still ends the same way.
*BOOM*
Okay, that's our cue to start firing!
Just try not to hit anything vital?
You should really be the one selling that to the crew...
@BATTLE
A word, Captain?
Speak.
That was wildly dangerous, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: You're right. I shouldn't have had the fish for dinner.
Care to specify? You seem to be angry about a lot of things.
You mean Kumano's request to take it slow?

Fields.DialogueText: That's not what I'm talking about, and you know it.
Well...that might be true, but this is a big one.
Do you mean in the last battle?
Fighting Morganas is already risky enough. Playing with them like that was like playing Russian roulette with an extra bullet.
Hey, Kan—Oh, you're here. Are you still complaining? It's done and we're alive. Get over it already.
I just want to make sure it doesn't happen again.
It won't. I got what I needed.
I hope it was important enough to risk—
*ALARM*
Sounds like this fight can wait until we've taken care of that one.
Yeah, that's what I wanted to warn you about.
I'm sure you were getting around to it eventually.
Let's just get in position, okay?
@BATTLE
What else would I be talking about?
Well, uh, then yes.
Kanchou, I've got another favor to ask.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think it'd be a good idea to slow down a battle again.
Ask away.
Nothing dangerous, I hope.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I've learned all I need to from that.
Okay, I will.
Not this time, I assure you.
I was hoping you could test my game with me.
You've finally finished it?
I've got a working demo ready. I need to test it before I can call it finished.
Well, yeah, let's play. I've been looking forward to it for a while.
Great, I'll go get everything ready.
*ALARM*
Sounds like we'll have to play after we take care of some Morganas.
Curse those spooky fuddy-duddies. Fine, but right after!
@BATTLE
So one side plays as the Morganas and the other plays as the Belles, right?
Exactly. And they each have their own sets of cards.
Cards? Oh, I see. That's what you've been drawing in that book of yours.
Right again. So do you want to be Morganas or Belles?

Fields.MenuText: Morganas. It could be fun to play as the bad side for once.
Belles. I'll stick with what I know.
You choose. I don't have a preference.

Fields.DialogueText: Then here you go. Just don't let the evil get to your head.
Smart choice. We are the best, after all.
Fine, then you can be Morganas. I like the Belles better.
Well, you...definitely drew all these yourself, huh?
I was able to make sketches of the Morganas when you let me observe them during battle.
They look... unique.
Okay, shut up. I know I'm not an artist. If the game takes off I'll get them redrawn.
*ALARM*
The real Morganas are attacking before the fake ones could attack in the game.
We'll have to play later, I guess. Maybe I can work on my speed sketching...
@BATTLE
You couldn't have used photographs?
I thought the genuine articles would be better studies.
Hmm... no, last round was the last of my starshells. That means no visibility for this brawl phase, and you've got the initiative.
Yes, Belles win again!
Yeah, but you had to sacrifice your Kumano to win. So cruel, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Sometimes you have to sacrifice a pawn to save a queen.
I didn't want to, but it was the only way to win.
If the real you wasn't so ruthless with her Morganas, the fake you could've survived.

Fields.DialogueText: So I'm a pawn now? You can barely handle one of me, let alone eight.
Is winning all that's important to you? You'd think that you were playing as the Morganas.
And still I lost. It seems ruthlessness isn't everything.
I just can't seem to win with the Morganas... Do you think I need to balance it a little more?
No, it seems about accurate. In my experience, the Belles are always kicking Morgana ass.
You have a point, Kanchou. But a game isn't fun unless both sides have a chance to win.
Then maybe balance it a little more. The Morganas did seem to be hurting for card draw. Other than that, you did a really good job.
Obviously. I made it, didn't I?
Captain, we've got Morganas inbound—what's that?
None of your business.
Sound the alarm.
Seriously, what is that?
That's the sound of the alarm not going off. Let's go fix that.
@BATTLE
Yes, yes. The game is yours.
Meaning... ?
No! That's impossible. There's no way Mahan could lose so easily.
Calm down; it's a game. It's your first match. You'll get better.
Screw it. I don't care about your stupid game. I've got better stuff to do.

Fields.MenuText: Teaching others your game?
Fighting weaker players because you couldn't beat me?
Finally won with the Morganas, huh?

Fields.DialogueText: Games are more fun when there are more players.
Everyone's weak when they start out. He'll get better.
I did a little tweaking. Their early game's a little less unforgiving now.
Is there a reason you used him to test the balance? Haven't you bruised his ego enough?
He wanted to learn. I needed to teach it to someone. Win-win, right?
Hey, what was that you guys were playing before? Can I play?
Oh, uh, sure. I'll have to teach you first.
I've got time.
*ALARM*
Actually, you don't.
After, then.
Sure, sounds good.
@BATTLE
Hmm. Your combat air patrol's been intercepted, which gives me the advantage. And your Vestures are tapped. Unless I'm much mistaken... that's the game.
You actually beat me. Good job.
Oh, yeah, take that! I knew I could do it.

Fields.MenuText: You got lucky.
Someone's a little full of herself.
*slow clap* Congratulations.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't get lucky. No room for luck with all this skill.
Sorry about that. I'll keep my awesomeness to myself.
Thank you, thank you. I'll be here all week.
Ahem. Sorry about that, I was just a little excited.
Yeah, a "little" excited.
Hey, so you know... the game has been spreading around the ship now.
Yeah, I've seen some of the crew playing it in the mess hall.
It's great. But there's a little problem.
With?
It still doesn't have a name. You know how bad I am with those.
Yeah, I guess it's kind of weird for a popular game to go unnamed.
So what do I do about it?
We can brainstorm. It shouldn't take too long to come up with something.
*ALARM*
Brainstorming will have to wait.
The faster we win, the faster your game gets a name.
Incentive indeed. Let's hurry this up.
@BATTLE
Kumano?
It's open!
What the hell are you doing?
Mass production. Popularity is something of a double-edged sword.

Fields.MenuText: At least you went with cards and not statuettes.
How many cards have you made?
With all this practice you'd think your skill would be improving.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, that would be much worse. I'm not that good with a knife, so thank goodness I'm a Belle or I'd probably be down a digit.
I stopped counting. Something around a thousand...maybe more.
My drawings are fine. You were able to differentiate Belles from Morganas in our last game.
Here, you can help by binding all the cards together in packs.
Sure. I can work a rubber band.
So what did you want?
I was coming to work on the name.
Well, I'm a little busy right now.
*ALARM*
Now I'm busier.
I guess I'll wait for you to come to me.
Probably for the best. I'm a busy girl.
@BATTLE
Morgana Wars?
I'm not sure I want war in the title.
Why? It's basically a war game.
How about just Victory?
That would suck for the loser. It'd be like rubbing their face in the title itself.
Well, this has been going on for too long. We just need to come up with a name and stick with it.
So just toss out the first thing we can think of?
Sure, sounds good enough.

Fields.MenuText: Victory Belles.
Belle-cheesi?
Yu-Gi-Belle.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm, not the worst suggestion. It could use some work, though. The development cycle's certainly giving us time.
What? Someone has food on the brain.
Now you're just tossing together characters. What does that even mean?
*ALARM*
Sounds like we're out of time. I guess that'll have to do.
I love the enthusiasm.
It's not set in stone, Kanchou. But you know how I hate to leave things unfinished.
@BATTLE
Except when you're drawing Morganas you've got a clear shot on.
Oh, do lighten up. The crew don't need me to babysit them.
Kanchou, Kanchou, Kanchou!
You sound happy.
I am. Everyone is loving the game! It's huge. The whole ship is playing!
So why are you here?
Well, I know that things go in and out of style just like that. So I was hoping to capitalize on the current popularity.

Fields.MenuText: I'm guessing you have something in mind?
Sounds like you want to do something big. And distracting.
Whatever it is, I'm on board. Let's do it.

Fields.DialogueText: I do. I always do. And now that I've gotten this started I couldn't stop it even if I wanted to.
Maybe a little, but it's nothing our crew can't handle.
I'm glad you're so agreeable. Especially since what I'm asking for is pretty big.
I want to throw a tournament. A tournament for the whole crew to compete to see who's the best [Player Selection from C12] player.
A tournament, huh? Sounds interesting.
So you're on board?
Sure. Just, uh, tournaments usually have prizes. So what does the winner get?
... It's a secret.
You hadn't thought about it yet, had you.
Lies. I think of everything.
You're fidgeting with your collar.
I am straightening it for the impending battle.
Both of these things can be true.
... Wait, did you say impending-
*ALARM*
So while we're on the subject of detection and reconnaissance-
You win. Let's go do our job.
@BATTLE
There are a lot of them, Kanchou.
It's your game. Get their attention.
Gather around, gather all! It's the time you've all been waiting for!

Fields.MenuText: What are you doing, Kumano?
Get off that table. You're going to break it.
You heard her, gather around like the sheep you are!

Fields.DialogueText: Wait and see.
My ship, my table. I'm repurposing it.
You're saying the quiet part out loud, Kanchou.
It's time for the event you've all been waiting for! Tournament time!
Woo!
You'll all place your names in this box and I'll arrange your battles.
Are there prizes?
I'm happy you asked! There will be prizes for tenth through first place. The grand prize will be awarded to the winner, if they can beat me.
Yeah!
Specifics will be determined based on number of entrants and amount of interest. Please enter your names as soon as possible and have a nice day!
Great, you done? Because we've got Morganas to take care of.
But I was going to arrange the bracket... Well, it'll be here when we return.
@BATTLE
Look at all these names!
That's certainly a lot of them.
I do have a complement of over eight hundred. I suppose this was inevitable. If I dumped these out could swim through these...

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you supposed to be doing something more important with those?
Swim? Nah. You might be able to take a bath in ‘em, though.
If you're going to just roll around in those, then make room for me.

Fields.DialogueText: They're falling all over themselves for something I made. Let me bask.
A bathtub would make less of a mess. Good idea, Kanchou.
Nah, we both can't be having fun. Who would be fighting the Morganas?
Okay, I guess that's enough fun. It's time to get to work.
You can make work fun too. If you do it right.
Obviously. That's why I'm always having fun.
*ALARM*
We've got Morganas.
Not so fast, Kumano. You're not leaving that mess in my office.
It's my office, Kanchou. You just work in it. Fortunately, so do I.
@BATTLE
The tournament's started. Look at everyone having fun. They're playing my game!
Yeah, everyone looks like they're enjoying themselves.
Wait, I just realized... You're not playing?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not all that competitive.
Wouldn't be fair for everyone else. I'm too good.
Oh, whoops, I totally forgot.

Fields.DialogueText: You? Not competitive? I don't believe that for a second.
Ha, sure. Whatever you want to tell yourself.
Either you're super forgetful, or you don't actually want to play.
It's too late now. The tournament's already started.
Too bad. I guess I'll have to wait for the next one.
Does that mean I have permission for another?
Maybe. For now, focus on this one. I'll keep an eye out for any Morganas. Someone has to.
Thanks, Kanchou. I'd do it, but I have to make sure no one starts cheating.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
More Morganas?! Just when things were getting heated up.
Okay, everyone, get in position, we've got a fight on our hands!
Leave everything where it is. We can pick up right where we left off after the battle.
You think the cards are going to stay in place? While there are explosions rocking the ship?
I've got a plan.

Fields.MenuText: We need you on deck.
Whatever the plan, I'll help.
Good luck with that. I'll be making sure the ship doesn't sink.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be quick about it!
We can't both be down here. Someone has to deal with the Morganas.
I'll be right there to help. Just got to finish this!
*BOOM*
Oh, no! They're getting all over the place!
@BATTLE
That's another down. One more step to that grand prize.
Dang, I was close too. Good game.
He's gotten better.
Yeah, I figured all he needed was a little practice. At this rate he could win the grand prize.
That reminds me, what are the prizes? What are they competing for?
Oh, I didn't tell you? It's a set of new cards. I'm going to start making expansion packs, and the winners get the first ones.

Fields.MenuText: Handmade? That's a lot of work you'll be going through.
Interesting. Maybe I should've entered.
Just make sure you don't get distracted from the real Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: I can take my time. It'll make them rarer.
Shoulda, woulda, coulda. It's too late now.
If anything, I'll get more focused on them. I'll need more designs, after all.
Kumano, I'm coming for you!
I'll be right here. Bring it on!
*ALARM*
Sounds like the Morganas thought you were talking to them.
Well, at least they waited for the round to be over this time.
@BATTLE
There must be more worlds to conquer...
What's on your mind, Kumano?
You think...other ships would like the game?

Fields.MenuText: Probably. It's pretty fun.
Is that what you want? For your game to spread to the four corners of the map?
Maybe, but you'd have to do a hell of a lot of work.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah... it is, isn't it? I'm glad you're enjoying it.
Creating something that everyone loves, something lasting... Sounds nice, doesn't it?
You're right about that. I'd have to make enough cards for a whole other ship. Perhaps more.
Whether you want it to spread or not, you should probably wait until Morganas only exist in history and your excellent hand-drawn cards.
You make a good point. I should keep my head in the game.
It always is, right?
Heh, right.
If that's it, I'm sure I have some paperwork waiting for me in my office.
Actually, I think we have something a little more important a few kilometers to the north.
Morganas? Are they coming our way?
They're not. That's what makes this fun for us.
@BATTLE
What are you doing in here? The tournament is about to start.
I told you. I've got a bunch of paperwork I need to do.
Seriously? That can wait. It's getting exciting down there. You don't want to miss it.

Fields.MenuText: If you keep distracting me, it's only going to take longer.
I'll finish it as fast as I can. Keep a seat warm for me.
[Player Selection] isn't as fun to watch as it is to play.

Fields.DialogueText: Or maybe it'll kick your butt into gear.
Lots of people are watching. Some of them might want your seat.
Tell that to all the members of the audience.
You can stay there and talk all you want, but I've still got work to do.
Ugh, you're so boring. Just hurry.
*ALARM*
Sounds like we all have to wait now.
I'll make it quick. The crew are hungry for the semifinals.
@BATTLE
Oh, we have a winner!
Woooo!
YAAAAAAAY!
Sounds like he's a crowd favorite.
It seems I now have an opponent for the grand prize.

Fields.MenuText: Getting nervous yet?
You can take him.
Who's the other guy?

Fields.DialogueText: Nah, he's still miles behind me.
Obviously. I mean, I'm me.
Doesn't matter. His luck's running out.
Anyway, we have some time before the finals. I'm going to make sure we're clear of Morganas.
Good idea. We wouldn't want them interrupting your final match.
Ideally. But the fact that there is a final in the first place means I've already won.
Against the Morganas?
I thought you didn't believe in luck.
I believe in luck. Otherwise, how would I make my own?
Oh, they don't enter into it. This is all about me.
And the eight-hundred-plus crew you've gotten hooked.
I did say you were a captive audience. The least I can do is make your captivity... captivating.
*ALARM*
Well, there's our distraction for the day.
Bold of you to call it that.
I'd say I earned it.
@BATTLE
WOOOOO!
Another victory! I told you I'd be coming for you, Kumano!
Don't get so cocky. You still have to beat me.
And I will. I'll beat you at your own damn game.
*ALARM*
I'd love to beat you now, but I've got some real Morganas to deal with.

Fields.MenuText: She's right. This pissing match will have to wait.
Nah, we probably have time. We can fix the ship later.
And here I was looking forward to the two of you going at it right here and now.

Fields.DialogueText: Lucky you.
Ugh, I hate when you're right.
Well, we'll have to put that match off. But only for a little bit.
@BATTLE
Battle's over, let's go!
Give me a second. After all, I did all the heavy lifting there.
Don't cause a scene, you two. Go to your separate corners.
The whole ship is my corner.
And I have to live there.
I'm sick of waiting, Kanchou. Whenever you're ready.
All right! Everyone, this is the grand finale!
WOOOOOOOOOOO!

Fields.MenuText: It's time for [Player Selection]!
Let's get ready to battle!
I don't know what to say here. So just...go!

Fields.DialogueText: Nice one, Kanchou. We'll make a host of you yet.
I guess that worked.
This is why I do all the rabble rousing.
Wish me luck?
You don't need it.
Damn straight.
@BATTLE
No, I... I couldn't have lost! You- you cheated!
Don't get so upset. No one can beat me with my own Belles.
Damn it, I demand a rematch.
Don't be a sore loser.
I'll be whatever kind of loser I want!
Give him a little time. He'll be fine.
All right, you're the top...nine players? We're missing one.
Someone is still pissed about losing to you, Kanchou.
I guess he can really hold a grudge.
Okay, well, I guess the nine of you will be getting your congratulatory expansion packs. With the tenth held in abeyance.

Fields.MenuText: I can bring him his.
I guess he doesn't want his pack.
Can I have his?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll take care of it, Kanchou. Don't worry about it.
Who wouldn't want their pack? He'd have to be crazy.
...It's tempting, but no. When he wants it he'll come for it.
So, you nine, approach the table and grab a pack of your choice.
Be wary: each pack has ten out of the fifty new cards, and there are no reprints.
Can we trade cards?
At your own peril. Even I haven't finished theorycrafting the potential strategies.
*ALARM*
But you can do that later. Pocket your new toys and get in position!
Ahem. Kanchou, that's not your toy that you just pocketed.
Just keeping it safe for the first loser.
Your words, not mine.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I've got a surprise for you.

Fields.MenuText: A good one, I hope.
Well, I've still got paperwork.
Hope you're not about to ask for another tournament.

Fields.DialogueText: A very good one. I know you'll love it.
This is better than paperwork. Come on, just take a little break.
Few and far between. I'm only one Belle. There's only so much game development I can do myself.
So what's your surprise?
It's a present!
A present? For what?
I wanted to say thank you. You really helped get this game off the ground. The art, too.
So you got me... More cards?
All fifty of the new cards that I put into the expansion packs. I wanted you to get them before everyone else.
This is... Thanks, Kumano. Do you have time for a game?
Of course. But don't think I'll go easy on you just because I like you.
I've got fifty new cards. If anyone should be worried, it's you.
Okay, fine.
Let's table that for now. Care for a warmup with the real thing?
